instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_CPU: What is PPVCORE_S0_CPU? This is the primary power rail for the CPU that powers the CPU, known as CPU vcore. Without this, the machine will be braindead. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.PP1V5_S0: What is PP1V5_S0? PP1V5_S0 is a 1.5v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.
definitions.PP1V8_S0: What is PP1V8_S0? PP1V8_S0 is a power rail that is present when the machine is in an S0 state, meaning it is fully turned on, not sleeping or hiberating .
definitions.PPVCORE_S0_AXG: What is PPVCORE_S0_AXG? This is vcore going to the CPU’s integrated graphics processor for CPUs that have an integrated GPU. When this is missing on a device that has an integrated GPU and no discrete GPU, it usually means either no screen is detected, or the GPU integrated into the CPU is dead..
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON – CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi Team,

This board came as dead with no green light , no <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>, broken traces around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> missing of a lot of small components like inductors and capacitors :<CAPACITOR>C9015</CAPACITOR>, L9004, L9400, <CAPACITOR>C9401</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C4319</CAPACITOR>, L9499, <CAPACITOR>C1699</CAPACITOR>,C162E, C169E, <CAPACITOR>C1695</CAPACITOR>.
After solving all this now the board is starting with the fan spinning to the max speed, no ram beep, no chime no display.
USB Mouse turning ON (red)


<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S0</SIGNAL>: 1.509V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_LDO</SIGNAL>: 1.056V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0</SIGNAL>:1.0803V
[B]<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>: 0V
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG</SIGNAL>: 0V[/B]
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>: 1.052V
L2406:1.052V
<SIGNAL>PP1V5_S3_CPU_VCCDQ</SIGNAL>: 1.506V
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0_CPU_VCCPQE</SIGNAL>: 1.055V
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_S0_CPU_VCCPLL_R</SIGNAL>: 1.795V
<RESISTOR>R5510</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5511</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5512</RESISTOR>: OK

Resistance between Pin 3 and Pin 6,7,8 is 2.5Ohm at <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR>, 7.7 Ohms at <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR> and 6.6Ohms at <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR>

I would like to replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR> and maybe <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> to try to restore <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> and see the fan speed later........
 What do you think?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Did you check <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> / <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR>? check for corrosion traces and measure good value.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Hi Jadao,  thanks for replying

I've checked check <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> / <RESISTOR>R7403</RESISTOR> both are ok but I've replaced <RESISTOR>R7412</RESISTOR> because this one wasn't in good shape and it's resistance was more than 5 MOhms.....
I've also reflowed all the <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> area, but it's still at the same point.

I'll pass it in the UC and get back to you guys, in the mean time if you have any suggestions, they're welcome.....
I'm still waiting someone to confirm me to replace or not <TRANSISTOR>Q7510</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7520</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7550</TRANSISTOR> and <CHIP>U7400</CHIP>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Ceck first if <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> is correctly powered up, pins 19, 29, 46.
It also needs 3V at pin 47.
At pins 1 & 48 you should see some drop pulse at least, if <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> tries to start.
Do you get <SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK25M_SB</SIGNAL> (25MHz) from <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>?
Also check all resistors and traces around SPI chip <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>.
Finally, try new BIOS dump...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
At <RESISTOR>R7401</RESISTOR> I have 5.085V on Pin 1 and 5.087V on Pin 2 so <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> is powered correctly checked also directly on pin 45/46 and pins 19/26 to avoid broken traces.
and I have 3.312V on Pin 47 so <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> is being told to turn ON.
On pin 48 I have a solid 12.37V and 12.33V on Pin 1.

At <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> I have 25Mhz clock signal

Between <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> and <CHIP>U6100</CHIP> I've noticed that <RESISTOR>R7404</RESISTOR> was missing so I installed an other one

Now I have:
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL>: 1.212V
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU_PH2</SIGNAL>: 1.197V
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_AXG</SIGNAL>: 0V

This time the board turns ON and it beeps when no ram is installed, but if I install a Ram memory I have NO display and the fan spin for around 5 seconds then stop in loop.
If I touch the <CHIP>U5511</CHIP> area it's really hot, it's just behind the CPU.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Try one DDR3-10600 module at a time only...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Question why 10600S and not 12800S? It's very interessting what your asking because:

With any 12800S ram in any slot it's starting for almost 5-6 sec then stops in loop same in smc bypass mode.

Without ram or with 10600S in any slot , fan spin non stop to the max and i've noticed the L7510 and L7520 are burning hot and can't keep my finger on them more than 1-2 sec like if the CPU is comsuming too much power, of course without the heatsink the machine stops after the fan reaches the max speed and I guess the over temp limit.

My guess maybe dead CPU.....but i'd like to have the experts point of view and also maybe any more steps to check in the troubleshoot process.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message: yes from another board: same symptoms, CPU area is getting super hot , fan runs at full speed.....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Any USB activity?
Normally VCORE should follow the sequence 1.1-0.95-0.85V...
AXG should appear with apox 1V and drops to 0V in few seconds.

Possibly bad CPU if gets very hot so fast.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Yes USB Activity ( mouse red light ON ) ......which means please?
VCORE Stays at solid 1.25V
AXG Stays at 0V never goes at 1V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no <SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
If VCORE doesn't drop to 0.8V aprox in 2-3s, then board is not working.
Apart of mouse light, can you see flashing light for an USB OSX pendrive?
AXG should appear just in the first seconds when board is powered and disappears completely in 3-4s.
